Rule.Name: Separate Web Content Directory (Manual)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: The web content directory is on the same partition as the Tomcat system files, which may lead to security risks.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure the web content directory is on a separate partition from the Tomcat system files.

Rule.Name: Restrict Access to Web Administration Application (Automated)
Rule.Section: Restrict Access to Web Administration Application
Rule.NonCompliantComment: Access to the web administration application is not restricted, which may allow unauthorized access.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Restrict access to the web administration application. Command : sed -i '/<Context/s/allow=".*"/allow="192.168.1.0\/24"/' $CATALINA_HOME/conf/server.xml; systemctl restart tomcat10

Rule.Name: Restrict Access to Manager Application (Manual)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: The manager application is accessible without restrictions, which may allow unauthorized access.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Restrict access to the manager application.

Rule.Name: Enforce SSL for Manager Application (Manual)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: The manager application is accessible without SSL, which may expose sensitive data during transmission.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Force SSL when accessing the manager application via HTTP.

Rule.Name: Rename Manager Application (Manual)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: The manager application is using the default name, which may make it a target for attacks.

Rule.Name: Enable Strict Servlet Compliance (Manual)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: Strict servlet compliance is not enabled, which may allow non-standard servlet behaviors.

Rule.Name: Disable Session Facade Recycling (Manual)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: Session facade recycling is enabled, which may cause session management issues.

Rule.Name: Disable Additional Path Delimiters (Manual)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: Additional path delimiters are allowed, which may introduce path traversal vulnerabilities.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Do not allow additional path delimiters.

Rule.Name: Set Connection Timeout (Automated)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: The connectionTimeout attribute is not configured, which may cause performance issues or allow unauthorized connections.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Configure the connectionTimeout attribute for secure connectors.

Rule.Name: Set Max HTTP Header Size (Automated)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: The maxHttpHeaderSize attribute is not configured, which may expose the server to denial of service attacks.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Configure the maxHttpHeaderSize attribute for secure connectors.
Rule.Correction: grep -q 'maxHttpHeaderSize=' $CATALINA_HOME/conf/server.xml && sed -i 's|maxHttpHeaderSize="[^"]*"|maxHttpHeaderSize="8192"|' $CATALINA_HOME/conf/server.xml || sed -i '/<Connector /{/maxHttpHeaderSize=/!s/\(<Connector [^>]*\)/\1 maxHttpHeaderSize="8192"/}' $CATALINA_HOME/conf/server.xml; systemctl restart tomcat10

Rule.Name: Enforce SSL for All Applications (Manual)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: SSL is not enforced for all applications, which may allow unencrypted communications.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Force SSL for all applications by configuring security constraints in web.xml for each application.

Rule.Name: Disable Symbolic Linking (Automated)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: Symbolic linking is enabled, which may expose sensitive files through unauthorized links.

Rule.Name: Disable Privileged Applications (Automated)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: Applications are allowed to run as privileged, which may allow them to perform unauthorized actions.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure applications are not run as privileged.
Rule.Correction: grep -q 'privileged=' $CATALINA_HOME/conf/context.xml && sed -i 's|privileged="[^"]*"|privileged="false"|' $CATALINA_HOME/conf/context.xml || sed -i 's|<Context|<Context privileged="false"|' $CATALINA_HOME/conf/context.xml; systemctl restart tomcat10

Rule.Name: Disable Cross-Context Requests (Automated)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: Cross-context requests are allowed, which may allow unauthorized access between applications.
Rule.Correction: grep -q 'crossContext=' $CATALINA_HOME/conf/context.xml && sed -i 's|crossContext="[^"]*"|crossContext="false"|' $CATALINA_HOME/conf/context.xml || sed -i 's|<Context|<Context crossContext="false"|' $CATALINA_HOME/conf/context.xml; systemctl restart tomcat10

Rule.Name: Disable Hostname Resolution in Logging Valves (Automated)
Rule.Section: Disable Hostname Resolution in Logging Valves
Rule.NonCompliantComment: The server resolves hostnames on logging valves, which may introduce performance issues.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Disable hostname resolution on logging valves.
Rule.Correction: grep -q 'resolveHosts=' $CATALINA_HOME/conf/server.xml && sed -i 's|resolveHosts="[^"]*"|resolveHosts="false"|' $CATALINA_HOME/conf/server.xml || sed -i '/<Valve/ s|<Valve|<Valve resolveHosts="false"|' $CATALINA_HOME/conf/server.xml; systemctl restart tomcat10

Rule.Name: Enable Memory Leak Listener (Manual)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: Memory leak detection is disabled, which may prevent identification of memory leaks in applications.

Rule.Name: Enable Security Lifecycle Listener (Manual)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: The Security Lifecycle Listener is not enabled, which may prevent secure initialization of the server.

Rule.Name: Enable logEffectiveWebXml and metadata-complete (Manual)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: The logEffectiveWebXml and metadata-complete settings are not configured, which may allow incomplete or insecure deployments.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure logEffectiveWebXml is set to true and metadata-complete is set for all applications.

Rule.Name: Encrypt Manager Application Passwords (Manual)
Rule.NonCompliantComment: Manager application passwords are stored in plaintext, which may expose sensitive information.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure manager application passwords are encrypted.
